Package ca.eandb.jmist.framework

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AffineTransformable2
    A two dimensional object that can be transformed according to an affine transformation (linear transformations plus translations).
    AffineTransformable3
    A three dimensional object that can be transformed according to an affine transformation (linear transformations plus translations).
    Animator
    Represents something that can be animated.
    AxisStretchable2
    A two dimensional object that can be stretched along the coordinate axes.
    AxisStretchable3
    A three dimensional object that can be stretched along the coordinate axes.
    Bounded2
    Represents something two-dimensional having bounded extent.
    Bounded3
    Represents something three-dimensional having bounded extent.
    DirectionalTexture3 Deprecated
    Display
    A target for rendering.
    Function1
    Represents a unary function.
    Illuminable
    Something that can be illuminated.
    ImageShader
    Computes the colour response for points on the image plane.
    Intersection
    A ray-geometry intersection.
    IntersectionRecorder
    Accepts a series of intersections.
    Lens
    Generates the ray to cast corresponding to given points on the image plane.
    Light
    A light source.
    LightSample
    A recorded sample from a Light.
    LinearTransformable2
    Represents a two dimensional object to which linear transformations can be applied.
    LinearTransformable3
    Represents a three dimensional object to which linear transformations can be applied.
    Mask2
    A two-dimensional grayscale texture, typically layered in to control the weight of some other property.
    Material
    Simulates how a SceneElement scatters and absorbs light.
    Medium
    Simulates how light travels through a medium.
    Modifier
    Applies a transformation to a ShadingContext, for example by perturbing the normal (bump mapping), or applying a Material.
    Painter
    Applies a Color to a SurfacePoint.
    PixelShader
    Computes a Color for a pixel (as indicated by its bounds, represented as a 2D box in normalized device coordinates).
    PixelSpectrumFactory
    A factory that creates extrapolated spectra from pixel representations.
    ProbabilityDensityFunction
    A continuous probability density function from which random samples may be generated.
    Random
    A random number generator.
    Raster
    A mutable, two-dimensional array of Colors.
    RasterWriter
    An array of pixels that may be written to, but not necessarily read from.
    RayCaster
    Computes ray-geometry intersections with an underlying scene.
    RayShader
    Estimates the colour channel responses along a given ray.
    RayTraversalStrategy3
    A strategy for determining with what objects to perform ray intersection tests.
    RigidBodyTransformable2
    Represents a two dimensional rigid body (something that can be rotated and translated).
    RigidBodyTransformable3
    Represents a three dimensional rigid body (something that can be rotated and translated).
    Rotatable2
    Something that may be rotated in two-dimensional space.
    Rotatable3
    Something that may be rotated in three-dimensional space.
    Scalable
    Something that can be scaled by a specified factor.
    ScatteringStrategy
    A surface scattering algorithm.
    Scene
    A scene to be rendered.
    SceneElement
    The basic component of a scene description.
    Shader
    Computes a Color from a ShadingContext, which represents the state of the current ray-intersection event.
    ShadingContext
    Represents the state of the current ray-intersection event.
    ShapePreservingTransformable2
    A two dimensional object to which shape preserving transformations (translation, rotations, uniform scaling) may be applied.
    ShapePreservingTransformable3
    A three dimensional object to which shape preserving transformations (translation, rotations, uniform scaling) may be applied.
    Stretchable2
    A two dimensional object that can be stretched along an arbitrary axis.
    Stretchable3
    A three dimensional object that can be stretched along an arbitrary axis.
    SurfacePoint
    Represents the properties of a point on the surface of some element in a scene.
    SurfacePointGeometry
    Represents the geometric properties of a point on the surface of some element in a scene.
    Texture2
    Maps two dimensional space to colors.
    Texture3
    Maps three dimensional space to colors.
    Translatable2
    Represents something that can be translated (moved) around in two dimensional space.
    Translatable3
    Represents something that can be translated (moved) around in three dimensional space.
    VisibilityFunction3
    A function that determines if a line segment or ray intersects something.
    Visitor
    Visits Objects in a collection.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AffineTransformation2
    An abstract base class for classes implementing AffineTransformable2.
    AffineTransformation3
    An abstract base class for classes implementing AffineTransformable3.
    BasisSpectrumFactory
    A factory for creating spectra from a vector space given the basis spectra.
    BoundingBoxBuilder2
    Builds a box that contains the elements added to it.
    BoundingBoxBuilder3
    Builds a box that contains the elements added to it.
    IntersectionDecorator
    An abstract Intersection that decorates another (e.g., by applying a transformation).
    IntersectionRecorderDecorator
    An abstract IntersectionRecorder that decorates another.
    InvertibleAffineTransformation2
    A class for classes implementing AffineTransformable2 that require the inverse of the transformation matrix.
    InvertibleAffineTransformation3
    A class for classes implementing AffineTransformable3 that require the inverse of the transformation matrix.
    NearestIntersectionRecorder
    An intersection recorder that only keeps the nearest intersection recorded.
    Photon
    A Ray3 with an associated Color.
    RasterUtil
    A collection of static utility methods for working with Rasters.
    RenderUtil
    Rendering utility methods.
    ScatteredRay
    Represents the properties of a ray-scatter event, which may be a ray scattered from a material interaction, or emission from a light source.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ScatteredRay.Type
    Describes the type of scattering.
